FuncDef:
The nat64 load-balance hash-arithmetic command configures the hash algorithm used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
The undo nat64 load-balance hash-arithmetic command restores the default hash algorithm used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
By default, the CRC64 algorithm using polynomial 0x1EDC6F41 is used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing.
CLIs: nat64 load-balance hash-arithmetic { hash-arithmetic1 | hash-arithmetic2 | hash-arithmetic3 }
undo nat64 load-balance hash-arithmetic { hash-arithmetic2 | hash-arithmetic3 }
ExtraInfo: The hash algorithm produces results, which differs with network traffic models. An appropriate hash algorithm can be selected based on the network traffic model. To configure a hash algorithm used to implement CGN ECMP and trunk load balancing, run the nat64 load-balance hash-arithmetic command. This command helps implement the best load balancing.
